jobs.title: American Sign Language Specialist – AI Trainer
jobs.description:
Are you an American Sign Language expert eager to shape the future of AI? Large‑scale language models are evolving from clever chatbots into powerful engines of linguistic and cultural understanding. With high‑quality training data, tomorrow’s AI can democratize world‑class education, improve accessibility for the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing communities, and accelerate communication tools for everyone. That training data begins with you—we need your expertise to help power the next generation of AI.

We’re looking for ASL specialists who live and breathe American Sign Language fluency, Deaf culture, visual linguistics, ASL grammar and syntax, non-manual markers, fingerspelling, and regional variations. You’ll challenge advanced language models on topics like ASL-to-English translation, classifier usage, receptive and expressive skills, facial expressions in ASL, and spatial grammar—documenting every failure mode so we can harden model reasoning.

On a typical day, you will converse with the model on real-world ASL communication scenarios and theoretical questions in signed language linguistics, verify linguistic accuracy and cultural appropriateness, capture reproducible error traces, and suggest improvements to our prompt engineering and evaluation metrics.

A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Deaf Studies, Sign Language Interpreting, Linguistics, or a related field is ideal; RID certification, teaching experience, or community interpreting projects signal fit. Clear, metacognitive communication—“showing your work”—is essential.

Ready to turn your ASL expertise into the knowledge base for tomorrow’s AI? Apply today and start teaching the model that will teach the world.

The ideal candidate is an experienced thermographer, preferably Level III certified, with a deep understanding of ASNT SNT-TC-1A guidelines, data center critical systems, and IR analysis for electrical and mechanical equipment. 

This position is critical in optimizing asset reliability, identifying early-stage failures, and supporting overall operational excellence. When you go to your doctor and need to be referred to a specialist (e.g., for sleep apnea), your doctor sends a fax (yes, in 2024, 90% of provider-provider communication is a 1980s fax). These are often converted into 20+ page PDFs, with handwritten (doctor’s handwriting!) notes, in thousands of different formats. The problem is so complex that a person has to read it, type it up, and manually enter your information. Tennr built RaeLLM™ (7B—trained on 3M+ documents) to read these docs, talk to your doc to ensure nothing is missed, and text you to help schedule your appointment so you can get better, faster.

Tennr is a NYC-based tech company that launched out of Y-Combinator and is backed by Lightspeed Venture Partners, Andreessen Horowitz, Foundation Capital, The New Normal Fund, and other top investors.

We are hiring for both full-time and part-time contract positions.

  • Review the model’s outputs to improve criteria determinations

  • Flag incorrect determinations, including false positives, false negatives, and unclear logic, with structured feedback

  • Compare documentation against Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial payer coverage policies

  • Analyze source materials (insurance policies, LCDs, etc.) to help validate qualification logic

  • Work closely with internal teams to refine prompting logic and improve documentation review standards

  • Maintain clear documentation of findings and contribute to process improvements

Who You Are

  • You have hands-on DME experience in roles such as intake, documentation review, audits, or quality/compliance

  • You are confident identifying when documentation meets or fails to meet payer requirements

  • You are comfortable reviewing insurance coverage policies and applying them to real-world cases

  • You are highly organized, detail-focused, and confident making policy-based decisions

  • You work well independently and value open communication within a remote team setting

Preferred Experience

  • 4+ years working in DME, ideally in documentation review, intake, audits, or compliance roles

  • Understanding of HCPCS codes and common DME categories such as respiratory, mobility, and maternal health

  • Experience with audits or appeals is a strong plus

  • Familiarity with decision logic or rules-based platforms is helpful but not required

jobs.title: Field Storyteller
jobs.description:
Overview

Ambrook’s mission is to help American family-run businesses become more profitable and resilient.

In the face of historic heat waves, drought, flooding, supply chain disruptions, water shortages, and pollution, climate impacts are intensifying across industrial America: from farmers facing crop losses, to truckers navigating fuel volatility, to contractors managing material shortages. Evidence shows sustainable practice upgrades deliver financial returns – from water-efficient irrigation to fuel-efficient fleets – but these changes require significant upfront capital and a clear proof of return-on-investment to owner-operators facing tight cashflows and razor-thin margins already. With data scattered across paper records and outdated systems, operators struggle to forecast whether a practice change will improve their bottom line – let alone prove business health to lenders and other funders.

Ambrook is solving this chicken-and-egg problem by re-architecting the financial data layer of America's independent businesses. We're replacing unruly paperwork and expensive, archaic tools with an affordable accounting, banking and payments platform that helps operators understand their numbers and access capital for sustainable transitions.

Ambrook customers are our economy’s historic backbone and a manifestation of the American Dream. Done right, both financial and environmental sustainability enables these entities to stay independent and resilient in the face of climate-driven volatility.

We’re starting by building for farmers and ranchers across America.

We’re a Series A startup backed by top investors (Thrive Capital, Dylan Field, Homebrew, Designer Fund, BoxGroup, and more) and are looking for early team members who are ready to untangle the knotted intersection between American industry and climate.

Learn more about our mission and what it’s like to work with us.

The Opportunity

Ambrook is built in partnership with the people we serve. We have logged countless hours in the field learning how financial decisions get made – all in the context of real life, on the ground. We sit with the folks who support them – accountants, bankers, and funding program managers. We attend industry group meetings to stay close to what communities of operators care about. These connections shape our product and build deep empathy across our team.

As our customer base grows, we need to increase our capacity to bring these stories to a wider audience. We’re hiring a Field Storyteller to capture and share the work of farmers, ranchers, and small business owners across America and contextualize Ambrook’s impact.

You’ll travel to customer operations, document their stories through video and photography, and turn those moments into content that connects with audiences. You’ll serve as the face of Ambrook on the road and for many, be the impression that deepens their loyalty in our brand. You’ll report to our Creative Director and work across customer success, sales, and product marketing to repackage and share these stories widely in various form factors that engage our different audiences.

What You’ll Own
Story capture in the field:

Travel to customer operations across the country to document their work through video, photography, and short-form interviews – capturing authentic, unscripted moments that bring their stories to life.

Being the face of Ambrook:

Ensure customers feel supported, seen, and celebrated throughout the storytelling process – from the first conversation to the final content.

Content production and packaging:

Turn raw footage and photography into ready-to-use content across various formats – short videos, social posts, ads, etc – always putting the customer’s story at the center.

Social media management and live capture:

Own Ambrook’s social media content calendar, production, and posting, including live posting from customer visits, events, and other on-the-ground moments that bring our brand to life in real time.

Cross-functional collaboration:

Work across customer success, sales, and product marketing to repackage and deliver content that supports customer engagement, lead generation, and brand storytelling goals.

Within 1 Month, You’ll...

  • Shadow customer success on calls to learn how we build relationships and show up for customers.

  • Learn Ambrook’s brand and voice and help establish how they play out in motion.

  • Hit the ground running – planning, capturing, and producing 5 customer stories in your month.

  • Deliver your first set of photo and video assets, ready for use across social, sales, and paid channels.

  • Establish a repeatable workflow for turning raw footage into publishable content at pace.

Within 3 Months, You’ll...

  • Become a content production machine – capturing, producing, and delivering a steady stream of high-quality content ready for customer success, sales, and marketing to deploy.

  • Maintain a high output while continuously improving your production process to be faster and more efficient, without sacrificing quality.

  • Repackage and distribute content across formats and channels, ensuring every team has what they need to engage our audiences.

  • Expand into new content formats or distribution methods based on what’s performing.

  • Maintain a consistent publication cadence on socials and increase engagement with our followers.

About You

  • You’re a storyteller at heart – photo and video is simply your medium.

  • You thrive in the field – capturing real stories, on the ground, in real time.

  • You’re personable and curious, able to build trust quickly and ask thoughtful questions that surface the most compelling story.

  • You have experience producing high-quality photo and video content quickly and consistently.

  • You know how to turn raw content into polished assets across multiple formats and channels.

  • You are well-versed in social media management and are confident in capturing yourself.

  • You’re adaptable and open-minded, always looking for better ways to work.

  • You’re an AI evangelist, eager to test and apply new tools that supercharge production and help you move faster without sacrificing quality.

  • You are capable of adopting a variety of tools at a pro level, including Figma (Design), Jitter (Animation), Descript and Veed (Video), Riverside (Interviews), or whatever else comes along next.

  • You bring creative ideas but aren’t precious – you balance speed and quality to keep content flowing.

  • You’re a self-starter who can own projects end-to-end, from planning to publishing.

  • You collaborate well across sales, marketing, and customer success to meet real business needs.

  • Bonus: You have experience in agriculture, rural storytelling, or working directly with small businesses in American industries.

Our values

Real Talk – We create space for ourselves and others to be straightforward, vulnerable, and accountable.

Reach Understanding – We are driven by curiosity and empathy to learn about our customers, team, and world.

Be Proactively Resourceful – We are internally motivated and externally empowered to identify opportunities and solve problems.

Derisk Thoughtfully – We lean into the biggest risks we face as a company and put in the work to address them systematically.

Find the Positive-Sum – We believe in creating incentive structures that align the needs of our company, our customers, and our planet.

Reporting to - Portfolio Director 

 

About Packt 

Packt's mission is to help the world put software to work in new ways, through the delivery of effective learning and information services to IT professionals. We are a technical publisher and learning provider with over 400 staff based across the globe, primarily in India and the UK. Our products have global relevance, and our multimedia portfolio includes over 7,000 books, e-books, audiobooks, and video courses.  

For more details, visit www.packtpub.com. 

 

Role Overview 

As an editor in a vertical, you will work in partnership with content creators to create high-quality products on time, according to the publishing plan. You own the product’s quality, working with the content creator and other internal stakeholders from the first idea, through the outline, to the delivery of the first draft of the content and on to publication. The goal of editorial is to raise the revenue performance of every product in every vertical by understanding content creator and user needs and the market we're publishing into.  

You are responsible for ensuring that the product’s vision is executed. You will ensure that products adhere to guidelines and provide enough depth and detail for the intended audience. You need to ensure that the product meets its specifications in the outline and that it is of high quality, signing off all content. 

The role is ideal for critical thinkers who can identify and articulate weaknesses in a product's organization and writing, using excellent English-language skills. You will adopt a coaching and mentoring role with content creators, using firm but diplomatic communication to help them shape their product, creating engaging technical content that allows readers to easily learn about new technologies and develop new skills.   

Each vertical will also have a unique mix of product types. The editor will, in addition to the above, work on different product types to ensure they all meet the standards expected by our customers. These product types may be derived products, such as an audiobook or course based on a book. They may be new products created through market and user research.  

This demands strong competitive immersion from editors: you will develop a deep understanding of the technical publishing market and competitive landscape. To do this you will have to seek customer feedback throughout the editorial process and apply this during your edits. It is vital you keep track of new tech releases and user trends. 

 

Adaptability and Evolving Role Requirements in Packt's Vertical Structure 

Packt’s move to verticals, bringing our teams closer to users, is a response to significant changes in the market. Due to AI, self-publishing, and multi-format options, the nature of the work and the business of publishing are changing. This is not just for Packt, but for the whole industry.   

Whereas in the past we had atomized and specialist roles in a single-format product lifecycle (e.g. development editor and acquisition editor for books), in the future we will need to be agile and flexible, prepared to adapt and stretch our skills and knowledge to new products and services. Each vertical team will evolve over time towards the offering and product suite that best serves its users. Vertical teams, and the work they do, will adapt accordingly.   

Examples of the agility we are looking for: in roles related to publishing, you will not only be working on books but also on other content formats that fit the preferences of your users (newsletter, live events, etc.). You may have a different team structure and line manager in your vertical vs other verticals. You will be open to taking on stretch projects and undertaking tests to evolve new product types. You’ll get proactively involved in team meetings so that you can contribute your ideas alongside the rest of the vertical team. Whatever role you are in you will be expected to connect with users and experts in your vertical, and to sustain ongoing relationships that provide value. This in turn means developing a level of domain knowledge in the technology and user roles in your vertical.   

In summary, the above means that a critical ‘power skill’ in the new Packt organization will be adaptability and flexibility – the ability to adjust quickly to changing circumstances and new challenges while remaining effective and open to different approaches.   

Only those with the willingness to adapt and flex in this new world should apply! 

 

What You Will Do 

Editorial: 

  • Evaluate and improve ideas and outlines, based on product reviews, Jobs-to-be-Done insights, and user interviews. 
  • On-board content creators and give detailed feedback on their content to allow products to proceed through the writing process. 
  • Provide a content health check for the portfolio director to facilitate accurate planning and time allocation. 
  • Continually assess the content in the product ensuring that the content contains all the required information according to the outline, as well as identifying and removing irrelevant content. 
  • Identify opportunities for content creators to improve organization, presentation, clarity and value. 
  • Make substantive edits: ensure that the structure, content, language, style and presentation of the content creator’s work are suitable for its intended purpose and readership; check for sentence complexity, conciseness and clear, logical development of ideas. 
  • Carry out user research and market analysis to elevate your editing. 
  • Work with technical reviewers to ensure technical accuracy of the content and code. This will include collating feedback from peer and tech. reviews and ensuring that this is effectively communicated to the content creator. 
  • Own the quality of a product: sign off products for production; decide when a product is suitable for cancellation; and tackle plagiarism within the product. 
  • Navigate the optimum balance of quality and timeliness in dialog with the rest of the product team. 

 

Author/Expert management:  

  • Provide detailed and constructive feedback to content creators using the appropriate tone to suggest the necessary actions that will ensure that the content matches the outline and meets Packt’s quality standards 
  • Build positive yet challenging relationships to get the most from your content creators 
  • Analyse a content creator’s language ability, adjusting your communication and feedback styles to fit different content creators 
  • Coach content creators on techniques for teaching difficult or important concepts  
  • Manage the author relationship to increase the quality of content and author satisfaction 

 

Technology:  

  • Research technology innovations to deepen your tech. knowledge in your vertical’s topic area 
  • Connect to users and research to deepen your knowledge of users in your vertical’s topic area  
  • Keep up with market changes that could impact the delivery or success of a product, for example, tech. version updates and competing titles  

 

Who You Are 

You are a detail-oriented, creative, and strategic content engineer with a strong passion for creating high-quality, technical content. You possess a deep understanding of editorial standards and are skilled at transforming complex ideas into clear, accessible, and engaging materials. You work collaboratively with authors, editors, and technical reviewers, balancing high editorial standards with commercial and product goals. You thrive in dynamic environments and continuously seek to optimize processes and workflows to deliver exceptional content. 

  

Must-have skills: 

  • Editorial excellence: proficient in substantive editing, with a focus on clarity, structure, and flow. Experience working with technical content and aligning it with editorial guidelines. 
  • Technical content understanding: strong ability to interpret and convey complex technical concepts clearly for diverse audiences. 
  • Quality assurance: rigorous attention to detail with a proven track record of ensuring content quality, accuracy, and consistency. 
  • Process optimization: ability to identify inefficiencies and suggest improvements in editorial processes and workflows. 
  • Author relationship management: strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build lasting relationships with authors, providing constructive feedback and ensuring their vision is realized. 
  • Stakeholder communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders. 

 

Good-to-have skills:

  • Adaptability: ability to adapt quickly to changing requirements and navigate ambiguity in fast-paced environments
